results.title: The Seven bridges of Koenigsberg
results.creator_credit: Bruce Cornwell and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: An animated film concerned with solving the problem of crossing the seven bridges of Koenigsberg, Germany, in a single continuous walk. Early attempts to solve it by trial and error are shown, including Leonard Euler’s analysis of the problem. This is a clearly explained and attractive film which would complement a study on topology or network theory. No other credits available. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: False note
results.brief_description: An animated story of a pathetic organ-grinder who cannot play an entire song without striking a sour note. He wanders through a city filled with neon signs, sleek automobiles, bank note collages, and humanoid figures, searching for a sympathetic response. The city’s indifference merges into hostility and the little musician is left only with his dreams. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Dalton Trumbo
results.creator_credit: Barbara Gordon and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: Dalton Trumbo, once a blacklisted author and screenwriter, summoned to appear before the House Committee for Un-American Activities in 1947, recalls his subsequent conviction for contempt of Congress. Trumbo explains his controversial decision to turn his anti-war novel, ‘Johnny got his gun’ into a feature film.

results.title: Polite language 1: human relations and the language
results.brief_description: The main aim of this film is to illustrate the various levels of polite, informal, and informal speech found in the Japanese language. Throughout the film many examples of greetings, leave-takings, invitations, formal and informal entertaining are shown.

results.title: Making a decision is...
results.brief_description: Examines the decision-making skill in the making of decisions varying from trivial to life’s choices. Explores key considerations in helping to arrive at decisions. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Good, good, good, good life
results.creator_credit: Rolf Forsberg, Karl Holtsnider and Teleketics
results.brief_description: This film serves as a plea for restraint and conservation in the use of goods and services, through the story of a self-sufficient retired man whose modern family deluge him with modern appliances, re-do his homely living room and attempt to introduce him to the “good life”.

results.title: Teenagers talk: getting through adolescence
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Presents teenagers from various ethnic backgrounds commenting on the difficulties of being an adolescent. Uses animated sequences to visually express such topics as sex, parents, drugs, peer pressure, individuality, conformity, friendship and physical maturation.

results.title: Surfing waves
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the action and properties of waves. Aerial views of the seacoast are used to show diffraction and refraction of parallel wave fronts and laboratory examples further exemplify this point. The action of convergent and divergent lens systems is also demonstrated. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Solar energy
results.brief_description: Investigates the possibility of utilising solar radiation. Shows methods of obtaining heat and electricity from the sun, installations already in operation, production of heat for high temperature and metal research, and the domestic use of solar energy. Gives working Australian examples.
